definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Molly after discharge, with little moxa came to a new home for illness.
sentences.chinese: 出院后莫利文带小艾来到新的住处养病。

sentences.english: Bear this gentleman to his quarters.
sentences.chinese: 把这位先生送到他的住处。

sentences.english: Noah walked with me toward Rose’s quarters.
sentences.chinese: 诺亚陪我一同朝罗丝的住处走去。

sentences.english: “We could go to my place, ” Cal said.
sentences.chinese: “我们可以去我的住处，”卡尔说。

sentences.english: They Covered Their Bodies With Bruises And Wounds, And Denied Them Food And Shelter.
sentences.chinese: 他们都被弄得遍体鳞伤，也得不到食物和住处。

sentences.english: Cannibals captured him and took them to their village.
sentences.chinese: 那里食人肉的野蛮人抓住了他，把他带到住处。

sentences.english: E. g. Most of our accommodation is self-catering.
sentences.chinese: 我们提供的住处大部分是伙食自理的。

sentences.english: Please forward our post to our new home when we move.
sentences.chinese: 我们搬家后，请将邮件转递到我们的新住处。

sentences.english: He gave the cobbler a gold coin and had the man show him Cassim's house.
sentences.chinese: 他给了补鞋匠一枚金币，叫他指出凯辛的住处。

sentences.english: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，我们要得神的住处，作为自己的产业。

sentences.english: Late returns, people find, sammo hung the dwellings of lamp incredibly still on.
sentences.chinese: 深夜返回时，大家发现，洪金宝住处的灯居然还亮着。

sentences.english: Accommodation was hard to find in the city and a place like this didn't come up very often.
sentences.chinese: 在城里很难找到住处，像这样的房子不常出现。

sentences.english: I have given the waste land for a heritage, and the salt land as a living-place.
sentences.chinese: 我使旷野作它的住处，使咸地当它的居所。

sentences.english: A battered woman finds free shelter.
sentences.chinese: 一名遭受家暴的妇女找到免费住处。

sentences.english: When we clean well the place where we are staying.
sentences.chinese: 那么也就是说我们洒扫住处的时候。

sentences.english: Behind the hall is the residence of the abbot and monks.
sentences.chinese: 正殿后面是方丈和僧人的住处。

definition: to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful
to put up a guest/to stay overnight
